channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report X-2024030711
item.description:
Report X-2024030711

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: FLORENCE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Extinguisher package has no orientation arrows. Package was set down upside down. Flimsy plastic used instead of metal blocking pin on discharge handle. Package was set right-side up and dispersion ceased. DescribePack: no metal pin in discharge handle DurationRel: -1 and MitigateEffect: Immediate area was cleared until vapor dispersed and vented.

item.title: Report X-2024030746
item.description:
Report X-2024030746

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was received from trailer leaking contents. Package was then move to safety bin. QA was called to investigate package. Package was then moved to hazmat cage for further inspection. Upon further inspection it was discovered that the bucket was damaged by a crack at the bottom. DescribePack: crack at bottom of bucket DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placing in bin and removed from area

item.title: Report E-2024030386
item.description:
Report E-2024030386

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: Columbia
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Rodrick White had an approximate 20 gallon spill of regular e10. He left the compartment open and then charged the belly valve resulting in product spilling. Rodrick cleaned up the spill prior to the Environmental crew showing up. A small amount of product went into the storm drain. The environment crew left out a boom over night to capture the product.
